content: sorry to ask this off-topic question but do someone have troubles to load github issues pages on Firefox?
it has been killing me, like I need to try to load them several times and at some point one of those tries suddenly works
but most of the time it keeps trying to load and never finishes so it does not render anything
I'm using some extensive Firefox privacy protections which may interfere in some way
I've been ok with privacy badger on in FF, but that's probably less than what firefox can be configured to do.
yeah, I'm not sure what's the issue about but is the only website that gives me this problem
I need to open the same issue on 7 tabs to have one working
I don't have any problems with firefox developer edition (83.0b2) + noscript + adblock plus + https everywhere + a relatively strict enhanced tracking protection configuration.
do you use privacy.resistFingerprint=true?
@bjorn3 :point_up:
I'm trying out with privacy.resistFingerprint=false
It seems I don't use it.
It seems like the issue is with that option on, since I've changed it back I'm not seeing the issue, still testing
I can't reproduce it with privacy.resistFingerprinting=true. I don't know if I have to restart firefox for it to take effect though.
unsure but I've disabled that and it works :/
yeah I've restarted but unsure if you need to do so
I have that enabled and no problems loading issues.
no idea, in my case is very clear that that enabled means having a ton of problems, probably is that + some plugin or something, who knows
@Santiago Pastorino I've had funky issues like that lately, and I solved those by wiping cookies for affected sites.

Iñaki Garay said:

Santiago Pastorino I've had funky issues like that lately, and I solved those by wiping cookies for affected sites.

yes, I'm also trying this, thanks!
